<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A function object that can be used as an ObjectTransformLayer transform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to dump object files to disk at a specified path.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dumpobjects"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dumpobjects/#afcdecffed69334cfd8fc517836656751">DumpObjects</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct a DumpObjects transform that will dump objects to disk.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param DumpDir specifies the path to write dumped objects to. DumpDir may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be empty, in which case files will be dumped to the working directory. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DumpDir is non-empty then any trailing separators will be discarded.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// @param IdentifierOverride specifies a file name stem to use when dumping</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// objects. If empty, each MemoryBuffer&#39;s identifier will be used (with a .o</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// suffix added if not already present). If an identifier override is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// supplied it will be used instead (since all buffers will use the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// identifier, the resulting files will be named &lt;ident&gt;.o, &lt;ident&gt;.2.o,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &lt;ident&gt;.3.o, and so on). IdentifierOverride should not contain an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// extension, as a .o suffix will be added by DumpObjects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dumpobjects/#afcdecffed69334cfd8fc517836656751">DumpObjects</a>(std::string DumpDir = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, std::string IdentifierOverride = </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Dumps the given buffer to disk.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MemoryBuffer&gt;</a>&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dumpobjects/#aa0dc48bd5c7938d84780ec3e63378a13">operator()</a>(std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MemoryBuffer&gt; Obj);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> getBufferIdentifier(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorybuffer">MemoryBuffer</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string DumpDir;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::string IdentifierOverride;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
